allOf.description: If all players are on the same platform, this will be the platform type. Otherwise, it will be `0`.

isDayOne.description: If the activity was completed before the day one end date

isContest.description: If the activity was completed before the contest end date

isWeekOne.description: If the activity was completed before the week one end date

allOf.description: The platform on which the player created their account.

displayName.description: The platform-specific display name of the player. No longer shown in-game.

isPrivate.description: Whether or not the player has chosen to hide their on Bungie.net.

page.description: Page number of leaderboard data. Ignored if `search` is provided. Defaults to 1

ActivityDefinition.description: The definition of an activity in the RaidHub database.

VersionDefinition.description: The definition of a version in the RaidHub database.

RaidHubPostGameCarnageReport.description: A raw PGCR with a few redundant fields removed

hashes.description: The mapping of each Bungie.net hash to a RaidHub activityId and versionId

activityDefinitions.description: The mapping of each RaidHub activityId to its definition

versionDefinitions.description: The mapping of each RaidHub versionId to its definition

listedRaidIds.description: The list of all activityId in order of newest to oldest

sunsetRaidIds.description: The list of inactive raid activityId

prestigeRaidIds.description: The list of raid activityId which had a prestige mode

masterRaidIds.description: The list of raid activityId which have a master mode

contestRaidIds.description: The list of raid activityId which had a contest mode

resprisedRaidIds.description: The list of raid activityId which have been reprised from Destiny 1

resprisedChallengeVersionIds.description: The list of version versionId which are the challenge mode for reprised raids

pantheonIds.description: The list of activityId for Pantheon

versionsForActivity.description: The set of versionId for each activityId

allOf.description: The platform on which the player created their account.

displayName.description: The platform-specific display name of the player. No longer shown in-game.

isPrivate.description: Whether or not the player has chosen to hide their on Bungie.net.

PgcrResponse.description: A raw PGCR with a few redundant fields removed

get.description: The RaidHub manifest provides definitions for all activities and versions in the RaidHub database.

Search for players in the RaidHub database by Bungie name or platform display name. 
Players who have not attempted a raid may not appear in the search results. 
Results are ordered by a combination of the number of raid completions and last played date.

allOf.description: Filter by Destiny membership type. Defaults to -1 (all). Note that the membership type of an account is determined by the platform the was first created on

schema.description: Search by bungie name. Defaults to true. Set this parameter to false to search by platform display name instead

get.description:
Get a player's activity history. This endpoint uses date cursors to paginate through a player's activity history. 
The first request should not include a cursor. Subsequent requests should include the `nextCursor` 
value from the previous response. Note that the first request may not return the full number of activities requested
in order to optimize performance. Subsequent requests will return the full number of activities requested.

An extremely low-cost API call. Get basic information Bungie information about a player. The information is not
guaranteed to be fully up-to-date, however, it should be accurate enough for most use cases where
you only have the membershipId available.

Get a player's profile information. This includes global stats, activity stats, and world first entries. 
This is used to hydrate the RaidHub profile page
This endpoint replaces the PGCR endpoint. It returns an object with a shape more aligned with how RaidHub displays PGCRs.

schema.description: Page number of leaderboard data. Ignored if `search` is provided. Defaults to 1

get.description: Individual leaderboards for a specific raid

schema.description: Page number of leaderboard data. Ignored if `search` is provided. Defaults to 1

get.description: Individual leaderboards for a specific pantheon version

schema.description: Page number of leaderboard data. Ignored if `search` is provided. Defaults to 1

get.description:
Ranking of the first 1000 completions of each activity version. 
Use the /contest endpoint instead to get the full rankings for the duration of the contest.

schema.description: Page number of leaderboard data. Ignored if `search` is provided. Defaults to 1

get.description: Ranking of all teams which completed the official contest version of the raid during the contest period.

schema.description: Page number of leaderboard data. Ignored if `search` is provided. Defaults to 1

get.description:
Get a raw post game carnage report by instanceId. 
This is essentially the raw data from the Bungie API, with a few fields trimmed off. 
It should be a subset of the data returned by the Bungie API. 
Useful if you need to access PGCRs when Bungie's API is down.

post.description: Run a query against the database
Authorize an admin user. Requires the client secret.
Authenticate a user. Grants permission to access restricted resources.
